travels.title: Argentina '08
travels.headertext: We visited Argentina in November 2008. Most of our time was spent exploring Buenos Aires. We did two major side trips: a day trip across the Rio de la Plata to Colonia del Sacramento, Uruguay and several days at Iguazu Falls.

entry.text: The Capitol of Argentina in Buenos Aires
The Argentina "Pink" house is the equivalent of the US white house. The pink color was chosen by a former president in an attempt to bring to together the "white" and "red" parties.
Colonia del Sacramento, Uruguay is an hour ferry ride across the Rio de la Plata from Buenos Aires. It has an old colonial section that's a popular tourist destination.
The church in historical Colonial del Sacramento.
The "devil's throat" at Iguazu Falls. Water pours in from three sides. The mist rises several hundred feet in the air.
Iguazu Falls are huge. They're over a kilometer wide.
Coati are a raccoon relative that populate the park around Iguazu.
